DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Negation Dose-Limiting Toxicity Protocol Specification Evaluation Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to a systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure based on specified objectives and criteria. Such events are not related to the harmful effects of the treatment drug associated with the dose or level of that treatment as specified on the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Negation Dose-Limiting Toxicity Protocol Specification Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure based on specified objectives and criteria. Such events are not related to the harmful effects of the treatment drug associated with the dose or level of that treatment as specified on the protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredName: Negation Dose-Limiting Toxicity Protocol Specification Evaluation
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.:The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A detailed description of criteria for a piece of work.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A detailed description of criteria for a piece of work.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
